intro: Crataegus subvillosa, commonly known as the silky hawthorn, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to North America. It is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and small, oval leaves with a silvery underside. The plant produces white or pink flowers in early spring, followed by red berries in the fall. It thrives in a variety of soil types but prefers well-drained conditions. Crataegus subvillosa is often found in open woodlands and along stream banks.
